intro: Koellensteinia, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, particularly in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Koellensteinia species are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their woody stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. They have adapted to harsh desert conditions through features such as thick, waxy leaves and deep root systems. The genus includes several species, with Koellensteinia lyrata being the most well-known for its ornamental value and ecological importance in desert ecosystems.
